data.title: Leo Lavin Obituary - North Grafton, Massachusetts
data.meta_description: SUTTON: Leo Michael Lavin, Jr., 64, passed away December 18, 2018 in the loving embrace of his family. He leaves his wife of 31 years, Mary (Sheridan) Lavin, his father Leo M. Lavin, Sr., his children Ken Henneberry, Maura Bettez and Kristen Lavin, grandchildren Liam and Owen Henneberry, and his sisters Beth DePasquale and Jean Ferreira. Leo was born September 11, 1954 in Worcester, son of the late Marie Paule (Girard) and Leo M. Lavin Sr. His roots were in Grafton, he graduated from Grafton High School in 1972. He served in the U.S. Army during the Korean Conflict and was honorably discharged with the rank of Sergeant (E-5) and received the National Defense Service Medal. Leo earned his Bachelor of Science degree specializing in Computer Science from Central New England College and went on to earn Master’s degrees from Worcester State College in Information Technology and Education. His lengthy career in computer science began at Digital Equipment Corporation in 1984 and his path took him to work at EMC Corporation, Oracle and most recently the NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory. Away from work his family was always at his center, he was always up for a trip to the movies and at home you could often hear The Beatles music playing. Please honor Leo in lieu of traditional remembrances with a donation to Wounded Warrior Project at https://support.woundedwarriorproject.org. All are welcome to gather with Leo’s family Friday December 21st from 4pm to 7pm at Roney Funeral Home 152 Worcester St. N. Grafton, MA 01536. His Funeral Mass will be celebrated Saturday December 22nd at 11:00am at St. Mary’s Church 17 Waterville St. N. Grafton, MA 01536. All attending the Funeral Mass are politely requested to go directly to church. He will then be laid to rest at Pine Grove Cemetery in North Grafton. A Book of Memories to share a story or message of sympathy with Leo’s family is available online at: www.RoneyFuneralHome.com

Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.
